Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis

Class Kruskal<V,X extends Comparable<X> & Sequenced>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis.MST<V,X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis.Kruskal<V,X>
Type Parameters:
V - the type representing vertices in the graph.
X - the type of the edge attributes; must implement Comparable<X> and Sequenced.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Edge<V,X>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeoKruskal
public class Kruskal<V,X extends Comparable<X> & Sequenced> extends MST<V,X>
The Kruskal class implements Kruskal's algorithm for finding the minimum spanning tree (MST) of an edge-weighted, undirected graph. It extends the MST abstract class and utilizes data structures such as a priority queue and a union-find structure for efficient processing. This class operates on graphs represented by the EdgeGraph<V, X> interface, where edges are defined by a pair of vertices and an associated attribute. The attribute must implement the Comparable interface for edge weight comparisons, and the Sequenced interface for sequence assignment in the resulting MST. The algorithm processes edges in non-decreasing order of their weights, adding them to the MST if they connect disjoint components without forming cycles.

  • Constructor Details

    • Kruskal

      public Kruskal(EdgeGraph<V,X> graph)
      Constructs a Kruskal algorithm instance for finding the minimum spanning tree (MST) of the given edge-weighted graph. The constructor initializes the necessary data structures such as a priority queue for edges and a union-find structure for connected components, and executes the algorithm to compute the MST. CONSIDER having a simpler constructor which just sets up the necessary structures, then having a run method which takes a graph and outputs an Iterable.
      Parameters:
      graph - the edge-weighted graph for which the MST is to be calculated. It must provide access to its vertices and edges via methods defined in the EdgeGraph interface.

  • Method Details

    • createEdge

      public static <V, X extends Comparable<X>> Edge<V,X> createEdge(V v1, V v2, X x)
      Creates an undirected edge connecting two vertices with an associated attribute.
      Type Parameters:
      V - the vertex type
      X - the attribute type; must implement Comparable<X>
      Parameters:
      v1 - the first vertex
      v2 - the second vertex
      x - the attribute associated with the edge
      Returns:
      an Edge<V, X> instance that represents the connection between v1 and v2 with the specified attribute

    • getMST

      public EdgeGraph<V,X> getMST()
      Retrieves the minimum spanning tree (MST) as an edge-weighted graph. This method constructs and returns an EdgeGraph instance containing edges from the priority queue in the order they are processed. Each edge in the resulting graph is assigned a unique sequence number during this operation.
      Returns:
      an EdgeGraph<V, X> instance representing the minimum spanning tree (MST).
